extracted_sections.section_title: What’s the best way to create a PDF?

subsection_analysis.section_title: What’s the best way to create a PDF?
subsection_analysis.refined_text: What’s the best way to create a PDF? You can create PDFs from documents printed on paper, Microsoft Word documents, InDesign® files, digital images, and more. Diﬀerent types of sources have diﬀerent tools available for PDF conversion. In many applications, you can create PDFs by selecting the Adobe PDF printer in the Print dialog box. If a file is open in its authoring application (such as a spreadsheet that is open in Microsoft Excel), you can convert it to PDF without opening Adobe Acrobat....

subsection_analysis.section_title: the File menu (macOS) > Create from scanner and follow
subsection_analysis.refined_text: the File menu (macOS) > Create from scanner and follow through the workflow. Microsoft Oﬃce Method 1 (Windows only): From the authoring application toolbar, select Adobe Acrobat > Create and Share Adobe Method 2 (Windows only): Open the file in its source application and then go to Print > Adobe PDF printer. subsection_analysis.section_title: toolbar, select Adobe Acrobat > Create and Share Adobe
subsection_analysis.refined_text: toolbar, select Adobe Acrobat > Create and Share Adobe Method 2 (Windows only): Open the file in its source application and then go to Print > Adobe PDF printer. Method 3 (Windows only): Right-click on the file and select Convert to Adobe PDF. Method 4: Drag and drop the file from your system to the Acrobat Home page. Method 5 (macOS only): From the authoring application, select File > Print > PDF > Save as Adobe PDF. Email messages Method 1 (Windows only): Within Microsoft Outlook or Lotus N...

Acrobat allows you to export images and text selections from a PDF to different file formats. Each format uses unique conversion settings when you export text or image selections. Export images from PDFs Besides exporting the entire document or each page to a different format, you can export each image in a PDF to a separate image file. You can export raster images, but not vector objects. 1. Open the PDF in Acrobat and select Convert from the top tools bar. Alternatively, from the All tools ...
Fill and Sign PDF Forms You can easily fill, sign, and share your documents using Acrobat's Fill & Sign tool. Types of PDF forms
